content:
I do not have detailed specifications for each of the electric heavy-duty trucks I listed, but I can provide you with some general information.

* Tesla Semi: Has a range of up to 500 miles on a single charge, with a top speed of 65 mph. Can haul up to 80,000 lbs of weight
* Rivian R1T: Has a range of up to 400 miles on a single charge, with a top speed of 125 mph. Can haul up to 11,000 lbs of weight.
* Nikola Two: Has a range of up to 600-800 miles on a single charge, with a top speed of 80 mph. Can haul up to 35,000 lbs of weight.
* Daimler eCascadia: Has a range of up to 250 miles on a single charge, with a top speed of 65 mph. Can haul up to 80,000 lbs of weight.
* Volvo VNR Electric: Has a range of up to 250 miles on a single charge, with a top speed of 65 mph. Can haul up to 80,000 lbs of weight.
* Freightliner eCascadia: Has a range of up to 250 miles on a single charge, with a top speed of 65 mph. Can haul up to 80,000 lbs of weight.
* Peterbilt Model 579 EV: Has a range of up to 300 miles on a single charge, with a top speed of 70 mph. Can haul up to 80,000 lbs of weight.
* Kenworth T680E: Has a range of up to 250 miles on a single charge, with a top speed of 65 mph. Can haul up to 80,000 lbs of weight.
* Mack LR Electric: Has a range of up to 230 miles on a single charge, with a top speed of 70 mph. Can haul up to 66,000 lbs of weight
* Fuso eCanter: Has a range of up to 62 miles on a single charge, with a top speed of 75 mph. Can haul up to 11,000 lbs of weight.

Please note that the range and top speed vary depending on the size of the truck, the weight of the load, and the battery type, and it also might vary depending on the manufacturer's specifications and configurations.
Also, Some of these truck manufacturers haven't provided detailed specification yet, and those that I've provided might not be accurate and could change as the production and delivery date of the vehicles are approaching.
